column4: OpenVPN uses the same security protocol as secure websites, and can operate over a single port. Did you have something more specific in mind? What is your friend's use case?
does he want to browse the internet as if he was a home (socks)? or does he want to get access to a terminal at home (ssh)? or does he need files from his home computer (scp)?
that is not something i've seen done before, but that doesn't mean it's not possible! a google search yields this apparently. you should check it out: http://www.thinvnc.com/index.html
basically then, you should try to embed a normal java vnc viewer in a webpage. then you can even use the built-in vino server
